prompt.p: Coagulation disorders may be inherited or acquired, and are the result of deficient or defective functioning of coagulation factors.
What coagulation factor is deficient in haemophilia A?

modalFeedback.p:
Option D (Factor VIII) is Correct. Haemophilia A is an inherited X-linked disorder where mutations within the factor VIII gene lead to defective function of the factor VIII-C molecule in the coagulation cascade.
Option A (von Willebrand factor) is Incorrect. Von Willebrand factor is deficient in von Willebrand's disease.
Option B (Factor V) is Incorrect. Factor V is a cofactor that is deficient in parahaemophilia (Owren parahaemophilia).
Option C (Factor VII) is Incorrect. A factor VII deficiency causes a mild, haemophilia-like disorder.
Option E (Factor IX) is Incorrect. Factor IX is deficient in Christmas disease (haemophilia B).
